Humans align with Heaven’s timing, interfacing with Heaven and Earth’s *qi*. The head’s roundness mirrors Heaven; the feet’s squareness mirrors Earth. The central *Qi* gathers, entering the Vermilion Palace, reaching the sinews and bones, ascending to the Cauldron within, then descending to the Gushing Spring, entering the Central Yellow Palace. All spirits merge, so when Azure Yang reaches the summit, all yin disperses. Then, utilizing the Five Phases’ true *qi*, internally refining into a single elixir within the Cauldron, one does not die—this is acting upon Heaven."*

The Yellow Emperor asked: *"The Cosmos lies within the hands—why?"*

The Celestial True Man replied:
*"The Cosmos is the origin of Heaven, Earth, yin, yang, and all things, shaped by yin and yang. Yin is Earth’s *qi*; yang is Heaven’s *qi*. Heaven’s *qi* descends; Earth’s *qi* receives it. Earth’s *qi* ascends; Heaven’s *qi* meets it. When Heaven’s and Earth’s *qi* intersect, yin and yang resonate, and all spirits transform and manifest.

Ancient Sages grasped Heaven and Earth’s yin-yang transformations’ primordial mechanism. The mechanism lies in utilization—those who know guard it. Guarding is the Dao, and thus one does not die.

I know the Cosmos’ mechanisms and continuously enact them, aligning with Heaven and Earth’s workings, never letting them stray. Over time, the spirit naturally ascends to the Primordial—thus one does not die. This is *the Cosmos within the hands.*"*

The Yellow Emperor asked: *"What does it mean that ten thousand transformations arise from the body?"*

The Celestial True Man replied:
*"The ten thousand transformations are the spirit. When essence does not scatter, the spirit does not depart. The Spirit Chamber is where all spirits congregate, located within Kunlun’s heart.

Common folk, however, dissipate essence and lose *qi*, unable to preserve the spirit—thus they do not know the law of generating the body.

The law of generating the body is the Dao of yin and yang. Hence it is said: *Ten thousand transformations arise from the body.*"

The Yellow Emperor asked: *"What is the Dao of the singular Qi that generates the body?"*

Guangchengzi replied:
*"From the singular Qi all things arise, yet one does not know how the singular Qi creates and transforms. One generates two, two generate three, and three generate ten thousand things. When a person receives the singular Qi, it transforms into the Three Qi—spirit, *qi*, and essence—and thus it is the Dao of generating the body."*

The Yellow Emperor asked: *"What is this 'one'?"*

The Celestial True Man replied:
*"The 'one' is the root of Heaven and Earth, the progenitor of yin and yang, and the origin of all things. It is the source of generating the spirit. If one can know the true essence-Qi of the 'one,' then all things will arise of their own accord and one will not die. Hence it is called 'one.' The Yellow Emperor said: 'The nature of Heaven is the human Dao; the human heart is the mechanism. What does this mean?'*

Guangchengzi replied:
*"Heaven uses the celestial *Lù* (斗) to govern its mechanism; humans use the heart as their mechanism. The heart is the spirit. When the heart’s mechanism aligns with the Dao, then the mysteries of ghosts and gods are realized. Before a person is born, they first receive the singular Qi as their fate, then the yin and yang Qi of their parents combine, and thus form is achieved. The spirit-fetus generates the spirit, so it is the origin of human nature. If a person can still their heart, like the movement of Heaven and Earth’s mechanism, they will be in harmony with Heaven and Earth. Thus, through the stillness of nature, the heart’s mechanism aligns with the Dao. Hence it is said: 'The nature of Heaven is the human Dao; the human heart is the mechanism.'*

The Yellow Emperor asked: *"How should one use the human heart as the mechanism?"*

The Celestial True Man replied:
*"The human heart is the origin of the mechanism. If one can preserve the heart and guard the spirit without forgetting the mechanism’s function, the heart is the source of all spirits. Calming the heart nurtures human nature. Thus the Sage calms their heart, embraces the origin, and contains the true essence. Containing the true essence is calming the nature. To take the heart as nature, to take *qi* as fate—when *qi* is exhausted, fate departs, and all is disordered in nature. Thus, they lose their *qi* and die. If one, like the Heavenly *qi*, remains clear and pure, they will not lose their nature. When nature is not lost, *qi* does not scatter; when *qi* does not scatter, fate does not depart; when fate does not depart, the form does not perish. Heaven and Earth are the origin of nature and fate. Hence it is said: 'The nature of Heaven is the human Dao; the human heart is the mechanism.'*

The Yellow Emperor asked: *"What is the Dao of establishing Heaven’s mechanism to stabilize the human Dao? What does this mean?"*

Guangchengzi replied:
*"The Dao of Heaven is the pure yang *qi*, so it takes pure yang as its foundation. If humans can contain the essence-Qi of Heaven’s transforming mechanism, like Heaven and Earth’s yang without abandoning it, and receive the singular correct *qi*, nurturing the body with the pure yang Dao of all spirits, then it is said: 'To establish Heaven’s mechanism to stabilize the human Dao.'*

The Yellow Emperor asked: *"How should one use the Dao of establishing Heaven’s mechanism?"*

The Celestial True Man replied:
*"The Dao of Heaven is the foundation of humanity. Parents are the beginning of humanity. If one can retain the form in its foundation without losing it to its beginning, and harmonize the spirit with the Dao, then it is said: 'To establish Heaven’s mechanism.'*

The Yellow Emperor asked: *"How does one retain the form without losing it to its beginning?"*

Guangchengzi replied:
*"If humans do not indulge in worry, anxiety, or overthinking, they will not lose their foundation. If they avoid illness, fatigue, and hardship, they will not lose their beginning. To lose one’s foundation is to destroy one’s fate; to lose one’s beginning is to return the form to the earth. If humans can cultivate and refine themselves according to the Dao, their *qi* will not lose its beginning—this is to know the principle. Hence it is said: 'The Dao of Heaven is the foundation of humanity; parents are the beginning of humanity.'*

The Yellow Emperor asked: *"When Heaven unleashes the killing mechanism, causing the stars to shift and their lodges to change—what does this mean?"*

Guangchengzi replied:
*"The mother of Heaven is the *Tàiyì* (太易). Within, it conceals the yin and yang Qi—these are the sun and moon. Before the sun and moon were divided, the Sage’s transformation generated the spirit, named *Tàiyī* (太一) as its origin. Then the sun and moon divided into yin and yang, and yin and yang further divided into the Five *Tàis* (五太). The Five *Tàis* are the Five Emperors. The Five Emperors then divided into the Eight *Guà* (卦), which pay homage to the center. The Sage’s transformation became the Nine Palaces, which is the divine palace of *Tàiyī*. Established are the Five Celestial *Lùs* (斗), with the Central *Lù* (中斗) within. The sun, moon, and stars are odd, and the Northern *Lù* (斗) receives the mechanism, directing the movement of yin and yang. When yin is the mechanism, death occurs; when yang is the mechanism, life occurs. The combination of yin and yang as mechanisms forms the Dao. Thus, *Tàiyī* governs the killing and life mechanisms, circulating through the Eight *Guà*, shifting the stars and changing their lodges. To return yin to yang is to achieve longevity; to return yang to yin is to die by the killing mechanism. Heaven’s four seasons create transformations, and the Eight *Guà* cycle endlessly—within the human body, these are also present, though humans do not know them. If one remains in yin and is killed, they die; if they cycle through rebirth, they lose their human form. If humans can refine themselves to attain the Dao, they will not lose their human form nor die by the killing mechanism. Hence it is said: 'When Heaven unleashes the killing mechanism, causing the stars to shift and their lodges to change.'*

The Yellow Emperor asked: *"What does it mean to not lose one’s human form and avoid the killing mechanism? What does this entail?"*

The Celestial True Man replied:
*"The *Tàiyī* (太一) abides within the Nine Palaces, entering and exiting at appointed times. It summons the Lord of the Great Yang to return to the Yang Hall, where the four seasons shift, the Eight *Guà* pay homage to the origin, and all spirits gather. The killing mechanism returns yin to yang, ordering the stars, and they return to the Golden Gate within. The Sage’s realm is supremely pure, and the Lord of the True Yang is *Bái Yuán Jūn* (白元君). If humans know this and can, with the true essence-Qi of *Tàiyī*, follow the mechanism and transform accordingly, returning to the pure yang of the Eight *Guà* and merging with the primordial *qi* of Heaven and Earth, causing the chapter of generating the spirit in the chaotic nine heavens to manifest, then they will realize the Dao of Heaven and attain eternal longevity, becoming true humans according to this transformation. Hence it is said: 'When Heaven unleashes the killing mechanism, causing the stars to shift and their lodges to change.'*

The Yellow Emperor asked: *"When Earth unleashes the killing mechanism, causing dragons and serpents to rise from the land—what does this mean?"*

Guangchengzi replied:
*"The harmonious singular Qi moves when it is unleashed, so Heaven’s mechanism does not cease. The killing mechanism is transformation. The dragon is the Heavenly *qi*—wind. The serpent is the Earthly *qi*—fire. If humans can circulate their essence-Qi, moving it up and down, seizing the mechanism of transformation, then the mysterious mechanism will depart. The Six Desires stir the mechanism’s balance, like the bodies of Heaven and Earth, where humans dwell. If there is true yang essence-Qi, it is called 'serpent,' ascending to connect with the primordial Heavenly *qi*, breathing and moving up and down, in resonance with Earth’s moving mechanism, rising and departing from the land."*

The Yellow Emperor asked:
*"Within the human body, what is the use of knowing this?"*

The Heavenly True Man replied:
*"Below the navel, one inch and three divisions, is the Sea of Qi. Within it lies a true essence of one *hun* measure, pressed into the Earth’s soil. Two meridians connect it to the brain. The brain contains a chamber called the Palace of Spirit Yang, with two orifices: the left is the Orifice of Supreme Polarity, the right is the Orifice of Penetrating Spirit. It ascends to connect with Heavenly *qi* and descends to the Sea’s source—thus is called breathing. When Heavenly *qi* descends and Earthly *qi* ascends, the two *qi* meet, nourishing the true essence, which is called the Dragon. The root of Azure Yang, descending, is the Serpent—this is the Primordial *qi*. When the two *qi* intermingle, they form the elixir; refined long enough, they become the Dan, hence immortality. Then the Yang Spirit transcends the body’s bounds, and within the human form, the Earth unleashes the killing mechanism, and dragons and serpents rise from the land."*

The Yellow Emperor asked:
*"When humans unleash the killing mechanism, Heaven and Earth reverse—why?"*

Guangchengzi replied:
*"When humans unleash the killing mechanism, they abandon the Six Desires and Seven Emotions. In stillness, they rest in emotion and intent; in motion, they move with spirit-mechanism. Internally, they employ spirit-*qi*, merging ascent and descent. Guarding the spirit is the Yang *qi*. The head’s roundness mirrors Heaven, the feet’s squareness mirrors Earth. When Heaven and Earth reverse, it is the ascent and descent of yin and yang; when humans reverse, breathing penetrates to the root. One inhale draws Heavenly *qi* downward, one exhale raises Earthly *qi*. Inhaling is Heavenly *qi*, exhaling is Earthly *qi*. My true *qi* meets them—humans can descend Earthly *qi* to the heavens above. Thus it is said: When humans unleash the killing mechanism, Heaven and Earth reverse."*

The Yellow Emperor asked:
*"When Heaven and Man unite in unleashing, the myriad transformations find their foundation—why?"*

The Heavenly True Man replied:
*"Heaven generates all things; humans are the foremost among the myriad living beings. Thus Heaven and Earth unite to nourish all things, and when humans harmonize essence-*qi*, all spirits rejoice. Heaven and Earth do not abandon them but follow, with spirit dwelling within. Spirit is the Dao of Heaven, and it loves purity. If impure, the spirit scatters, failing to align with Heaven’s Dao. The ancient sages preserved essence to nourish spirit, stored *qi* to nourish essence, and thus aligned with Heaven’s Dao, becoming True Persons. Heaven has one *qi*, Earth has two principles, within are three luminaries. The four seasons are complete, the five phases arrayed, the six extremes generating, the seven celestial officials as mechanisms, the eight trigrams unified, the nine palaces filling Heaven and Earth. The Five Star Revolving Sphere exists in humans as well. If humans receive Heaven and Earth’s singular *qi*, harmonizing with all spirits, aligning with the two principles, the Great Dan is formed. The singular *qi* moves endlessly through the four seasons; within, one *qi* spreads across the central soil. The five phases invert internally, the six yangs ascend to the Golden Threshold, the seven truths dwell eternally within the body, the eight trigrams arise in the Primordial Palace. The three luminaries mingle, white snow drifts; the seven officials complete their function, yellow sprouts grow within, the nine palaces thread through myriad phenomena—thus aligning with Heaven’s Dao. Hence it is said: When Heaven and Man unite in unleashing, the myriad transformations find their foundation."*

The Yellow Emperor asked:
*"Nature has skill and clumsiness—how can it be concealed and stored? Why?"*

Guangchengzi replied:
*"Heaven’s nature cannot be disordered. If spirit-*qi* is disordered, one does not know how to manifest spirit. Concealing and storing means nature like the bright moon, naturally communicating with the Dao. The skilled internally govern Heaven’s mechanism; externally, nothing enters, thus concealing wisdom and storing spirit, aligning with Heaven’s Dao. The clumsy do not know their own spirit-*qi* aligns with the Dao. They let the heart and intent generate emotions, freely scattering spirit-*qi*, failing to understand Heaven and Earth’s transformations, confusing yin and yang—thus they die. Hence nature has skill and clumsiness."*

The Yellow Emperor asked:
*"How does skillful nature conceal and store itself?"*

The Heavenly True Man replied:
*"Nature is spirit—it must not be disturbed. Thus when spirit is settled and *qi* harmonized, the Primordial *qi* descends. Concealing means not coveting desires or cravings; storing means hiding in spirit-light, with *qi* entering the Vermilion Palace, the gathering place of myriad spirits. Concealed and stored, unmoving, the myriad spirits do not scatter. Thus it is said: Concealing and storing spirit settles transformations; long refinement yields the Dao—thus nature is skilled, not clumsy."*

The Yellow Emperor asked:
*"The nine orifices’ evils lie in the three essentials—how can they be moved or stilled?"*

Guangchengzi replied:
*"The nine orifices: the heart contains nine orifices, housing nine *qi*—above are the three Pure *qi*, in the middle the three Sovereign *qi*, below the Primordial Source *qi*, which is essence-*qi*-spirit. They enter and exit in due time, mingling as one, externally communicating through ears, eyes, mouth, and nose—the yin within. The three essentials: spirit-*qi* and essence merge, the Mysterious Female Jade Gate, ascending to Heaven, descending to Earth, centrally connecting with the three Sovereign Ancestral *qi*—this is the Dao of the three essentials. Moving or stilling the ears, eyes, mouth, and nose: observing with the eyes disturbs the heart, listening with the ears shifts the spirit, speaking with the mouth scatters *qi*, smelling with the nose turns essence and marrow into turbid yin-water. If deliberately kept still and unmoving, the heart’s two orifices—left called Mysterious, right called Female—descend into the Sea of *Qi*, ascending to the Mud Ball. This is where true *qi* communicates, causing spirit-*qi* to move the mechanism, the Jade Gate closing of its own accord. Piercing the spine’s victory, passing the three passes, and facing the North Pole, the Yang Palace moves to preserve the true spirit. The ancient sages said: Move with spirit-mechanism, still with heart-intent. Essence-*qi*-spirit are the three essentials. Thus it is said: The nine orifices’ evils lie in the three essentials."*

The Yellow Emperor asked:
*"Fire arises from wood—when disaster strikes, it must conquer. Why?"*

The Heavenly True Man replied:
*"Wood without fire does not burn to ash; humans without evil nature do not die."*

chunks.original_text: 木中有火，火发必焚，其真炁乃成，烟焰即上升而归天，火缎木为灰炉而归土。 凡人性恶为火，火出则神散，神散则气离，气离财身死，真阳之炁归於天，浊阴之质归於土。 谓火从木生，即以水救之即不灰； 人起火性，以柔而救之即身不坏。 人之火发，而万神皆散，故死也。 人能制火，祸不能克，乃成大道。 故曰：火生於木，祸发必克也。 黄帝曰：奸生於国，时动必溃，何也？ 广成子曰：国中有奸，久而破国，身中有邪，久而亡身。 国去其奸则邦宁，人去其情即身安。 去奸者，六欲七情，三尸也，人能制奸邪者，成其大道也。 故曰：奸生於国，时动必溃也。 黄帝曰：如何得安身也？ 天真皇人曰：万物盗太虚真炁，人腹中有蛊，盗万物之炁，而名虰蛊。 虰蛊者，化为佞聂。 佞虫者，贼我之魂魄，亡我之神气，散我之精血，死我之形也。 人能知阴阳造化，起真火炼阴邪之奸，故杀虰虫，不令为害，故得身安，返成大道也。 黄帝曰：知之修炼，谓之圣人，何也？ 广成子曰：上古圣人用神机测天地阴阳，升降有时，要知火候之数，下火依时，戊己宫内，本始生神之母也。 知者复归其母，勿令放失，更受天炁为青阳之首，合地炁真阴之母。 我之神气，精在其中； 五炁皆全，心静无欲； 用火缎炼，炼成纯阳； 造化成道，魄返阳魂； 情阴尽灭，松形玉骨； 百关无漏，上达於天界，乃为真人也。 故曰：知之修炼，谓之圣人也。 阴符经三皇玉诀卷上竟 阴符经三皇玉诀卷中 黄帝曰：天生天杀，道之理也。 天真皇人曰：天生者，人归元道，正发复升，生也。 内合天作，至道生真； 遁隐在世，其人能测； 圣机内明，外通天地，故知者不死也。 天杀者，为人不信天道，任意损失精神炁，故害物不过天数而死，杀也。 故曰：天生天杀，道之理也。 黄帝曰：天生天杀，如何用也？ 广成子曰； 为人修道，不知天时，归根复始，错认根源，故死也。 若人知天时真炁，归根复命，要知造化者，乃有虚无真源，阴阳合一，为五行正炁也。 乾坤相胜，要知进退，乃无生死。 夫人道为本，若不知生杀者，是谓补不足而损有余，道之理也。 故曰：天生天杀也。 黄帝曰：天地，万物之盗； 万物，人之盗； 人，万物之盗。 三盗既宜，三才既安。 何也？ 天真皇人曰：天以一炁而长养万物。 天地炁散，万物盗之； 万物炁散，人以盗之。 人知盗万物之真炁养形，更知升降顺天时，接天炁，夺之造化，长生不死，乃人盗万物之天炁，故成道也。 人不晓造化者，为万物复盗人之炁，即因五谷而生，即因五谷而死，乃人被万物复盗之而死也。 黄帝曰：人盗万物，如何不死？ 广成子曰：人受冲和之炁而生，故不死也。 既禀受，有情欲而死也。 若能存一炁，故保神。 天以一炁而生万物，更与阴阳相和、五谷共备，人乃实腹强骨，不失精炁神，故不死也。 三盗既宜者，人能盗天地万物之炁以通神明，与天地相宜，三才以安。 人之精神与天地同而好清静，是以圣人恬淡虚无，真气存元，精神内守，岂得死也？ 故食饱者，而伤於精血，太劳者而散於神炁，心起情欲者，万物岂得不盗之也？ 故止饮食而身自轻，止思虑而神自灵，止嗜欲而神自清，故乃得道也，何劳外求？

If a person can control deceitful evil, they attain the Great Dao.* Hence it is said: *Deceit originates within a state, and when its time comes, it must collapse.*

The Yellow Emperor asked: *How does one achieve bodily security?*
The Heavenly True Man replied: *All things are thieves of Heaven’s true *qi*; within the human abdomen lies the pestilence (*wù*), which steals *qi* from all things and is called *wù* (pestilence). Thus they slay the pestilence, preventing its harm, and achieve bodily security, returning to the Great Dao.*

Those who know return to their mother, lest they lose her. They then receive Heaven’s *qi* as the leader of Qingyang (Pure Yang), and merge Earth’s *qi* with the mother of true Yin. My spirit-*qi* and essence are preserved within; the Five *qi* are all complete, the heart still and without desire. Refining with fire, I transform into pure Yang; through Daoist cultivation, my vital essence returns to Yang spirit, my Yin passions utterly extinguished. My form becomes like a pine’s, my bones like jade; the hundred passes are sealed without leakage, ascending to the Heavenly Realm—thus I become a True Person. Hence it is said: *To know and cultivate is called the sage.*

The Yellow Emperor asked: *Heaven gives life, Heaven takes life—this is the Dao’s principle.*
The Heavenly True Man replied: *Heaven gives life when a person returns to the original Dao, their true nature emerging and ascending, thus life. Internally harmonizing with Heaven’s creation, they reach the ultimate Dao and give birth to true essence. Hidden in the world, such a person can measure [the Dao]; their sage-like spirit-mechanism is internally clear, externally communicating with Heaven and Earth. Thus, those who know do not die.*

Hence it is said: *Heaven gives life, Heaven takes life—this is the Dao’s principle.*

The Yellow Emperor asked: *How does one apply Heaven’s giving and taking?*
The Master Guangcheng replied: *If a person cultivates the Dao without knowing Heaven’s times, they mistakenly return to the root and origin, thus dying. But if a person knows Heaven’s true *qi* and times, they return to the root and restore their command. They must understand that the Creator’s essence is the true source of emptiness, where Yin and Yang merge as One and become the Five Phases’ true *qi*. Heaven and Earth vie in victory, knowing advance and retreat—thus there is no birth or death. The human Dao is the foundation; if one does not know life and death, this is called supplementing the insufficient while harming the excess—this is the Dao’s principle.*

Hence it is said: *Heaven gives life, Heaven takes life.*

The Yellow Emperor asked: *Heaven and Earth are thieves of all things; all things are thieves of humans; humans are thieves of all things. When the Three Thefts are balanced, the Three Talents are secure. Why?*
The Heavenly True Man replied: *Heaven nourishes all things with one *qi*. When Heaven and Earth’s *qi* disperse, all things steal it; when all things’ *qi* disperse, humans steal it. Humans know to steal all things’ true *qi* to nourish their form, further knowing to ascend and descend in harmony with Heaven’s times, to receive Heaven’s *qi* and grasp its transformations, achieving immortality and not dying. Thus humans steal Heaven and Earth’s *qi* from all things, and this is how they attain the Dao.*

*If humans do not understand the transformations, all things will steal back humans’ *qi*—thus they live by the Five Grains and die by the Five Grains. This is how humans die from being stolen by all things.*

The Yellow Emperor asked: *If humans steal all things, how do they not die?*
The Master Guangcheng replied: *Humans receive the harmonious *qi* of the cosmos to live, thus they do not die. Once they receive it, their passions and desires cause them to die. If they can preserve the One *qi*, they protect their spirit. Heaven nourishes all things with One *qi*, further giving Yin and Yang harmony and the Five Grains’ completeness, thus humans become full-bellied and strong-boned, not losing their essence-*qi*-spirit, and thus do not die. When the Three Thefts are balanced, humans can steal Heaven and Earth’s *qi* to communicate with their spirit and nature, harmonizing with Heaven and Earth, thus securing the Three Talents. The human spirit and *qi* are in accord with Heaven and Earth, and they love purity and stillness. Thus sages remain serene and empty, true *qi* preserved in its origin, spirit guarded internally—how could they die?*

Thus it is said: *"When the Three Thieves are harmonized, the Three Talents are at peace."*

The Yellow Emperor said: *"Thus it is said: 'Eat in season, and the hundred bones will be in order.' Why so?"*

The Heavenly True Man replied: *"In the Age of Great Antiquity, the sages ate the *qi* of Heaven in due measure, and naturally the hundred bones became supple and harmonious. Drawing the true *qi* of Great Harmony into the body-field, the five *zàng* organs became cool and clear, the six *fǔ* organs balanced and serene, the joints moved freely, and the spirit settled in peace. To eat out of season seizes upon the workings of Nature—this is the Great Dao. Hence it is said: 'Eat in season, and the hundred bones will be in order.'"*

The Yellow Emperor asked: *"When the Original *Qi* flows through the hundred passes, how should one employ it?"*

Master Guangcheng replied: *"The *qi* of Heaven is soft and yielding, penetrating sinews and bones, nourishing the spirit and calming the essence—all to make the joints flow freely. Who does not know that regulating *qi* is the foundation of humanity? The foundation of humanity is the *qi* of Heaven! Thus the common folk use it daily without knowing. The rising and falling of *qi*, the ebb and flow of yin and yang, all have their times. Receiving a single breath of *qi* nourishes all things, as the *lingzhi* mushroom thrives in winter without dying. So too, when a person attains the Dao, they do not die—this is when the Original *Qi* flows through the hundred passes."*

The Yellow Emperor said: *"Stirring the mechanism, all transformations are at peace. Why so?"*

The Heavenly True Man replied: *"The divine mechanism operates within, and through myriad transformations, the Dao is naturally realized. Hence the mechanism—it opens the Heavenly Pass, and the Jade Gate closes of its own accord. When fire ignites the Heavenly Pass, it refines the marrow into pure yang, and fire follows, long refined into elixir—thus it is called the mechanism. All transformations—when *qi* condenses into spirit, returning to the Golden Pass at dawn—naturally settle the spirit, preserving the body for long life without death. The mechanism is subtlety. When a person moves the mechanism, their body transforms endlessly, inner and outer in harmony, the Dao of spirit united. Hence it is said: 'Stirring the mechanism, all transformations are at peace.'"*

The Yellow Emperor said: *"People know their spirit when it manifests, but not how it manifests when unseen. Why so?"*

Master Guangcheng replied: *"People observe external omens of good and ill fortune and pray earnestly for their fulfillment, unaware that within their own bodies lies the spirit—capable of communicating with Heaven and Earth, of inner cultivation to attain the Dao, of manifesting the divine yang-spirit’s sacred communion. Why seek it externally? Essence begets *qi*; essence is the mother of *qi*, and spirit is the child of *qi*—these are the Three Treasures. Refined into the True Person, they are called Immortals. Hence it is said: 'This is how the spirit manifests.'"*

The Yellow Emperor said: *"The sun and moon have their cycles, great and small have their measures. From this, the sage’s work arises, and the divine light emerges. What is the mechanism of this Dao?"*

The Heavenly True Man replied: *"The sun and moon are the essence of yin and yang. Thus they move and fulfill their numbers, traversing the world, combining cold and heat. Sixty days complete one cycle; four cycles complete a full measure, fulfilling the intent of Heaven and Earth. Fixed in the sun and moon, they circulate within the Dao—hence 'entering and exiting sun and moon, abiding within the numbers.' The numbers are One; One is *qi*; *qi* condenses into spirit, and the divine light emerges. The divine light is yang-essence—nothing escapes its discernment, nothing evades its illumination. Thus the sage probes the union of sun and moon, and the divine light emerges, knowing the workings of Heaven and Earth’s creation, seizing the mechanisms of yin and yang’s transformations, and thus generating the spirit. Entering the hidden and emerging from the obscure, the numbers coalesce into One to form the person. The Dao is non-action. The mechanism is the heart’s intent. Skilled in unleashing the transformations of yin and yang, entering the boundless numbers—this is the rectitude of the Dao’s non-action. The mechanism is release. The sage seizes this mechanism: nine yangs and six yins, unified into One—thus the sun and moon have their cycles, great and small their measures."*

The Yellow Emperor said: *"None under Heaven can know it, none can see it. Why so?"*

Master Guangcheng replied: *"For those of the world who are greedy, covetous, and given to licentious indulgence, they do not know the Dao of Heaven and lose their mechanism, dissipate their essence, and scatter their spirit. None can know it because the Dao’s mechanism is profound, and yin and yang remain unseen. Not recognizing the workings of Nature—this is why they do not know. They lose their spirit, scatter their blood and *qi*—how could they know? Those who would know must still the heart, cultivate the nature, steady the *qi*, and preserve the spirit—then clarity arises of its own accord. This is the Dao; this is seeing the spirit. Hence it is said: 'None under Heaven can know it, none can see it.'"*

The Yellow Emperor said: *"The noble attains it and endures hardship; the petty know it and slight their lives. Why so?"*

The Heavenly True Man replied: *"Thus the sage endures hardship in the Great Dao, capable of harmonizing the principles of Heaven and Earth’s yin and yang, securing their life. The sage attains knowledge, steadies their *qi*, and does not lose their essence. When essence and *qi* unite, they form the Great Medicine—all through knowing the workings of Nature, refining the spirit without scattering, steadying the *qi* and harmonizing the spirit. The petty do not know the root of life and spirit and thus cannot preserve them, losing their body and life. Not guarding their spirit but indulging the world, they lose their spirit and slight their lives, failing to preserve themselves—thus they die. The noble practices it diligently and endures hardship; the petty slight their lives, always dissipating their spirit and losing their bodies. Hence it is said: 'The noble attains it and endures hardship, while the petty slight their lives.'"*

The Yellow Emperor said: *"The blind excel in hearing, the deaf excel in sight. Why so?"*

Master Guangcheng replied: *"Those who scrutinize the autumn hair’s tip do not see the great mountain; those who listen to the rustling of insects do not hear the thunder. Those who excel in hearing are not because their ears are keen, but because they discern sounds and thereby self-destruct; those who excel in sight are not because their eyes are sharp, but because they scrutinize colors and thereby self-destruct. The blind, not seeing the light of sun and moon, discern the interplay of yin and yang, and through long practice attain longevity. The deaf, not hearing thunder, discern the passage of sun and moon, and through long practice attain enduring vision."*

chunks.original_text: 夫视者内见其机，听者内闻其声。 此两者，合道也。 故曰：瞽者善听，聋者善视也。 阴符经三皇玉诀卷中竟 黄帝曰：绝利一源，用师十倍。 何也？ 天真皇人曰：绝名弃利，元炁自守； 绝巧弃智，盗贼无有。 绝於声色，更用元炁，抱一守中，胜贵人十倍。 太上用大道，至於天下为圣。 师藏火於中源，久而不动，动而自然合於大道焉。 用智巧，故离其欲，而胜师十倍。 故曰：绝利一源，用师十倍也。 黄帝曰：三返昼夜，用师万倍。 何也？ 广成子曰：三返者，三元也。 天元真炁居首，灵源真炁居中，本源真炁居下。 是以精气者，师也。 心者，君也。 形者，炉也。 用精日夜，遇三元，上下无穷，而用之兼倍； 精神元炁不散，形体不衰，而通於昼夜。 昼则日用而明阳，得夜炁内，动阴炁於外。 阳炁者，精神之本也； 阴炁者，败我之形也。 若能精神遇三元之祖炁，上下混而为一，如师使之万神，俱其一化，其神昼夜不停，阴魄俱消，三阳独居於内，久而神自朝元，故不死也。 故曰：三返昼夜、用师万倍也。 黄帝曰：心生於物，而死於物。 何也？ 天真皇人曰：用心者，意动也。 意动则神移，神移则气散，气散则命亡，故死也。 心正者，是神定也。 制者则心正一炁之源，内动之机，万化皆通； 心乱则万神皆废，故去情意则万神不失於物也。 故曰：心生於物，而死於物也。 黄帝曰：机在目。 何也？ 广成子曰：道之远者在八化之外，近在眉睫之间； 大则包含天地，细则贯串眉毛。 神机内动，目睫飞铅，故神机在目，为其间有神室。 内动之机，在目而明也。 非常景通道见，阴邪自灭，真境返正，见阳神於天道。 故曰：机在目也。 黄帝曰：天之无恩，而大恩生。 何也？ 天真皇人曰：以天道而化下方，万物自然生，乃大恩生也。 不可以色欲纵其心，而使其意乱财邪恩生，故有死也。 安其心以保其神，自然流通，岂不知乌不染而自黑，鹤不浴而自白，蛛不教而成网，燕不招而自来？ 如此，自然恩生。 故曰：天之无恩，而大恩生也。 黄帝曰：迅雷烈风，莫不蠢然。 何也？ 广成子曰：迅速如雷霆，阴阳正气也。 人能食风气，用阴阳之气，上下精气，蠢然而已。 行道运动，阴阳神气内交，真精上移而入於脑中，复降迅速如风雷，三元布满而百骸火飞，炼阴而返纯阳，是以圣人速了道也，内修真体自妙，如瑞草受阴阳冲和之气，故不死，莫不蠢然也。 黄帝曰：至乐性余，至静则廉。 何也？ 天真皇人曰：至乐於神者，阴阳之本也。 至者，定也，定於心意，阴阳自合。 至静则廉也。 目不观於色而神不移其炁内保自然，至乐於天真也。 去其欲，静其心，定其意，守其神，抱一至静而入新换旧，乃达於道。 圣人致性命合於天道，志刚则廉也。 故曰：至乐性余，至静则廉也。 黄帝曰：天之至私，用之至公。 何也？ 广成子曰：天乃清阳之气，至私者，暗发也，则生於万物，人在其中，复正神也。 若能收藏元气，补养天真，更能善用其功而成道也，谓之至公。 精气固身，知者依时运用，上入泥丸，下入海源，会於中宫，以接元气，度元关，朝金阙，三田相灌，百节俱通，周身火发，久而炼之，得成仙矣。 故曰：天之至私，用之至公也。

The Yellow Emperor said: *"The Dao/Way is such that the one who attains it remains in poverty, while the petty slight their lives."*

The Yellow Emperor said: *"The blind excel in hearing, the deaf excel in sight. Why so?"*

Master Guangcheng replied: *"Those who perceive the Dao/Way’s workings within, do not see its external manifestations; those who hear the Dao/Way’s resonance within, do not hear its external sounds. These two—perception and hearing—are in harmony with the Dao/Way. Thus it is said: 'The blind excel in hearing, the deaf excel in sight.'*

From the *Yinfu Jing* of the Three Sovereigns, the *Jade Precepts* (卷中竟).

The Yellow Emperor said: *"Cut off one source of profit, and you employ the Master tenfold. Why so?"*

The Heavenly True Person replied: *"Cut off fame and abandon profit, and the primordial *qi* naturally preserves itself. Abandon cleverness and discard wisdom, and thieves and robbers will have no sway. Cut off attachment to sounds and colors, and further employ the primordial *qi*. Embrace the One and guard the center, and you surpass the noble tenfold. The Supreme Dao/Way employs the Great Dao/Way, reaching perfection in the world and becoming Sage. The Master conceals fire within the central source; long practice renders it motionless, and when it moves, it naturally aligns with the Great Dao/Way. Using wisdom and cleverness, one departs from desire, thereby employing the Master tenfold. Thus it is said: 'Cut off one source of profit, and you employ the Master tenfold.'*

The Yellow Emperor said: *"Threefold return of day and night, and you employ the Master ten-thousandfold. Why so?"*

Master Guangcheng replied: *"Threefold return refers to the Three Primordials. The Heavenly Primordial *qi* resides above, the Spirit Source Primordial *qi* in the center, and the Root Source Primordial *qi* below. Thus, *jingqi* (精气) is the Master; the heart is the sovereign; the body is the furnace. Employing *jingqi* day and night, encountering the Three Primordials, boundless above and below, you employ it with tenfold efficacy. The spirit’s primordial *qi* does not scatter, the form does not decay, and thus it harmonizes with day and night. By day, the sun’s *qi* is employed and the yang is illuminated; the night’s *qi* is drawn inward, and the yin *qi* is expended outward. The yang *qi* is the root of the spirit; the yin *qi* is the ruin of the form. If one can let the spirit’s primordial *qi* meet the ancestral *qi* of the Three Primordials, blending above and below into unity, like the Master commanding the ten-thousand spirits to transform together, their spirits never cease, the yin shadows all vanish, and the Three Yangs reside alone within—after long practice, the spirit returns to its original state, hence deathlessness. Thus it is said: 'Threefold return of day and night, and you employ the Master ten-thousandfold.'*

The Yellow Emperor said: *"The heart is born of things, yet dies by things. Why so?"*

The Heavenly True Person replied: *"Using the heart means letting the mind move. When the mind moves, the spirit shifts, and when the spirit shifts, the *qi* scatters—when the *qi* scatters, life departs, hence death. A steady heart means a settled spirit. The Master regulates the heart, aligning it with the One source of *qi*, harmonizing its internal workings, and letting all transformations flow through. A disordered heart means all spirits are lost; thus, abandoning emotions and desires, the ten-thousand spirits will not be lost to things. Hence it is said: 'The heart is born of things, yet dies by things.'*

The Yellow Emperor said: *"The mechanism lies in the eyes. Why so?"*

Master Guangcheng replied: *"The Dao/Way’s distant aspect lies beyond the Eight Transformations, its near aspect between the brows and eyelashes. It encompasses the vastness of heaven and earth, yet penetrates the fine threads of an eyebrow. When the spirit’s mechanism moves within, the eyelashes stir like lead—thus the spirit’s mechanism lies in the eyes, for there is a divine chamber between them. The internal workings of this mechanism manifest in the eyes. When extraordinary visions align with the Dao/Way, yin evils naturally perish, the true realm returns to purity, and the yang spirit is seen in the heavenly Dao/Way. Thus it is said: 'The mechanism lies in the eyes.'*

The Yellow Emperor said: *"Heaven’s greatest lack of favor, yet great favor is born. Why so?"*

The Heavenly True Person replied: *"Heaven’s Dao/Way transforms the lower realm, and all things naturally arise—this is the birth of great favor. One must not indulge the heart with color and desire, lest it be disordered by false favors and thus bring death. Calm the heart to preserve the spirit, and it will flow naturally—does one not know that crows are not dyed yet black, cranes do not bathe yet white, spiders need no teaching to weave their webs, and swallows come without being summoned? Thus, great favor is born naturally. Hence it is said: 'Heaven’s greatest lack of favor, yet great favor is born.'*

The Yellow Emperor said: *"Swift as lightning, fierce as wind—none fail to comply. Why so?"*

Master Guangcheng replied: *"Swift as thunder and fierce as wind are the harmonious *qi* of yin and yang. If a person can nourish the wind’s *qi*, employing the *qi* of yin and yang, the primordial *jingqi* above and below, they will comply naturally. When the Dao/Way is practiced and the body moves, the yin and yang spirits internally blend, the true essence ascends and enters the brain, then descends swiftly as wind and thunder. The Three Primordials are fully manifested, and the hundred bones glow with fire—refining the yin and returning to pure yang, hence the Sage swiftly completes the Dao/Way. Internally cultivating the true body, its marvels unfold—like the rare grasses that receive the harmonious *qi* of yin and yang, hence they do not die, and none fail to comply. Thus it is said: 'Swift as lightning, fierce as wind—none fail to comply.'*

The Yellow Emperor said: *"Greatest joy leaves a residue, greatest stillness brings purity. Why so?"*

The Heavenly True Person replied: *"Greatest joy in the spirit is the root of yin and yang. 'Greatest' means settled—settled in heart and mind, and yin and yang naturally harmonize. Greatest stillness brings purity. The eyes do not gaze upon colors, the spirit does not shift, the *qi* is preserved naturally—this is the greatest joy of Heavenly Truth. Abandon desire, still the heart, settle the mind, guard the spirit, and embrace the One in greatest stillness, entering the New to replace the Old—thus attaining the Dao/Way. The Sage aligns nature and life with Heaven’s Dao/Way; firm resolve brings purity. Hence it is said: 'Greatest joy leaves a residue, greatest stillness brings purity.'*

The Yellow Emperor said: *"Heaven’s utmost selfishness, yet its use is most public. Why so?"*

Master Guangcheng replied: *"Heaven is the clear yang *qi*—its utmost selfishness is the hidden emergence, giving birth to all things. The person within it, when restored to purity, attains the Dao/Way. If one can gather and preserve the primordial *qi*, nourishing Heaven’s Truth, and further master its functions to perfect the Dao/Way, this is called utmost publicness. The primordial *jingqi* solidifies the body—those who know depend on the times to employ it: ascending into the *nirvana* (泥丸), descending into the *sea of origins* (海源), meeting in the *Central Palace* (中宫), to receive the primordial *qi*, pass the *Primordial Pass* (元关), and approach the *Golden Gate* (金阙). The Three Fields (三田) mutually irrigate, and the hundred joints all harmonize—fire blazes throughout the body. Refined long and thoroughly, one attains the Dao of the Immortal. Thus it is said: 'Heaven’s utmost selfishness, yet its use is most public.'"

chunks.original_text: 黄帝曰：禽者制在气。 何也？ 天真皇人曰：禽者，乌也。 乌者，心气也。 故飞腾而有时。 气者，虚无之发，人能致其气，久炼为仙也。 禽者，南方火也，人能致其道，使真气久而如禽飞在太空，人能擒收在中元，炼成正阳，乃得为飞仙矣。 故曰：禽者制在气也。 黄帝曰：生者，死之根； 死者，之根。 何也？ 广成子曰：生巧者，死於命。 人能定心除六欲七情者，神定道生也。 若心生欲、情性巧者，神散命亡，死之根本也。 心死永得复生，乃生死之根也。 黄帝曰：恩生於害，害生於恩。 何也？ 天真皇人曰：圣人恩生於道，凡人恩生於情，亡其身，害其命也。 损有其余而补不足，有余者，心有情欲，补不足也，精神散也。 纵心起欲色，是恩中生害而亡其神也。 若能澄心不倦，其神自明，是害中生恩。 苦志修心而不乱，则害忘也，保其神也。 故乃成道和快於心，灭於欢乐而保精神，忘情无欲，至此为圣人也。 故曰：恩生於害，害生於恩也。 黄帝曰：愚人以天地文理圣，我以时物文理哲。 何也？ 广成子曰：凡人知有天地文理，言圣人外像不知我自有天地阴阳，我藏也。 阴阳者，鬼神不测之法也，天地通大小幽冥之理，愚人所作，不知我与天地阴阳时物皆同。 天地之理，圣人之机也。 至道之，万物之本，阴阳之宗，故变化无穷，乃至於道至精，我之有也； 道之自然，万物有物，我为哲也。 阴阳之非胜，奈我同而胜也。 胜者，我之神也。 神者，至道之源也。 故我灵而阴阳同圣。 天地也，二炁结而万物皆同，神炁超时，圣於大道也。 吾晓大道包含天地，明哲尽矣。 旨真之理，我自然圣化三清也。 黄帝稽首再拜，谢圣君指教愚昧，臣方晓大道。 圣君遂驾云鹤升空而去，黄帝回辇而还都矣 阴符经三皇玉诀卷下竟

The Yellow Emperor said: *"The bird is governed by qi. Why so?*
The True Man of Heaven replied: *The bird is the crow—crow is the heart’s qi. Thus it soars and descends at its appointed times. Qi is the manifestation of the void; when a person gathers it, prolonged refinement yields the Dao of the Immortal. The bird is the fire of the South; when a person attains its Way, the True Qi endures like a bird flying through the void. If one can seize and gather it within the Central Primordial, refining it into True Yang, then one attains the Dao of the Flying Immortal. Hence it is said: 'The bird is governed by qi.'*

The Yellow Emperor said: *Life is the root of death; death is the root of life. Why so?*
Broad-Nurturing Child replied: *Those skilled in life perish by fate. If one steadies the heart and eliminates the Six Desires and Seven Emotions, the spirit settles and the Dao arises. If the heart generates desires and emotions, the spirit scatters and fate is lost—the root of death. When the heart dies, eternal rebirth is attained—this is the root of life and death.*

The Yellow Emperor said: *Kindness arises from harm; harm arises from kindness. Why so?*
The True Man of Heaven replied: *The Sage’s kindness arises from the Dao; the commoner’s kindness arises from emotion, destroying the body and harming fate. To take from the surplus and supplement the deficient—those with surplus are those whose hearts harbor desires, while the deficient are those whose spirit scatters. When the heart indulges in desire and lust, kindness breeds harm and the spirit perishes. If one can clear the heart without weariness, the spirit naturally illuminates—this is harm yielding kindness. With steadfast resolve and unperturbed cultivation, harm is forgotten, and the spirit is preserved. Thus the Dao harmonizes and delights the heart, extinguishing joy and preserving the spirit, abandoning emotion and desire—this is the Sage. Hence it is said: 'Kindness arises from harm; harm arises from kindness.'*

The Yellow Emperor said: *The foolish man takes Heaven and Earth’s patterns as the Sage’s virtue; I take the timing of things as the philosopher’s wisdom. Why so?*
Broad-Nurturing Child replied: *The commoner knows only of Heaven and Earth’s patterns, speaking of the Sage’s outward form while unaware that I possess the yin-yang of Heaven and Earth within. Yin and yang are the unfathomable laws of ghosts and gods, the vast and subtle principles through which Heaven and Earth communicate. The foolish man’s works are ignorant; he does not know that I, along with Heaven and Earth’s yin-yang and the timing of things, are all the same. The principles of Heaven and Earth are the Sage’s mechanism. The utmost Dao is the origin of all things, the essence of yin and yang—thus its transformations are boundless. When the Dao reaches its utmost refinement, it is mine. The Dao’s spontaneity gives rise to all things; I am the philosopher. Yin and yang cannot overcome me, for I am the same and thus victorious. Victory is my spirit; the spirit is the source of the utmost Dao. Hence I am divine, and my yin-yang aligns with the Sage. Heaven and Earth—two *qi* conjoin, and all things are the same. My spirit transcends time, and I am Sage to the Great Dao. I comprehend the Great Dao encompassing Heaven and Earth; wisdom is now complete. The essence of True Reality—naturally, I am transformed into the Three Pure Ones.*

The Yellow Emperor bowed twice in reverence, thanking the Holy Sovereign for enlightening his ignorance. The Sage then ascended to the sky upon a clouded crane, and the Yellow Emperor returned to his capital in his carriage.

*The Three Sovereigns’ Jade Precepts of the Yin Symbol Classic, Lower Scroll, ends.*
